text: Haji Kusa (; ) is a village in northern Aleppo Governorate, northern Syria. It is located in a sparsely populated area, some east of al-Rai, northeast of al- Bab and west of Manbij. Administratively part of Nahiya al-Rai in al-Bab District, the village has a population of 1,011 as per the 2004 census. On 12 November 2016, Haji Kusa was captured by the Syrian National Army from ISIS. ==References==
title: Haji Kusa
